title: Tandoori-Style Grilled Meat or Shrimp
summary: You can never have too many main course recipes, so give Tandoori-Style Grilled Meat or Shrimp a try. For $2.7 per serving, this recipe covers 20% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Watching your figure? This gluten free and primal recipe has 302 calories, 39g of protein, and 12g of fat per serving. This recipe serves 6. This recipe from Epicurious has 1 fans. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 5 hours. It will be a hit at your The Fourth Of July event. If you have yogurt, salt and pepper, lamb chops, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. To use up the plain yogurt you could follow this main course with the 5-Minute Healthy Peach Frozen Yogurt as a dessert. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 76%. This score is good. Try Grilled Tandoori Style Shrimp with Mint Chutney, Tandoori-Style Grilled Chicken, and Grilled Tandoori-Style Chicken Drumsticks for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                                        1 In a blender, puree the first 8 ingredients until they form a paste.                                                                2 In a large bowl, toss your protein with the marinade. Chill for at least 4 hours or overnight.                                                                 3 When ready to cook, heat the grill and shake any excess marinade from the protein. Grill 9 minutes for chops, 6 to 8 minutes a side on a covered grill for chicken, or 4 minutes a side for shrimp. Serve.

steps.step: 1 In a blender, puree the first 8 ingredients until they form a paste.
2 In a large bowl, toss your protein with the marinade. Chill for at least 4 hours or overnight.
3 When ready to cook, heat the grill and shake any excess marinade from the protein. Grill 9 minutes for chops, 6 to 8 minutes a side on a covered grill for chicken, or 4 minutes a side for shrimp.
